FuncDef:
The peer-link mac-address remain enable command configures an M-LAG device not to trigger the local or peer M-LAG device to delete the corresponding MAC address on the peer-link interface under certain conditions.
The undo peer-link mac-address remain enable command configures an M-LAG device to trigger the local or peer M-LAG device to delete the corresponding MAC address on the peer-link interface under certain conditions. The peer-link mac-address remain enable command configures an M-LAG device not to trigger the local or peer M-LAG device to delete the corresponding MAC address on the peer-link interface under certain conditions. The undo peer-link mac-address remain enable command configures an M-LAG device to trigger the local or peer M-LAG device to delete the corresponding MAC address on the peer-link interface under certain conditions. By default, the M-LAG device does not trigger the local or peer M-LAG device to delete the corresponding MAC address on the peer-link interface under certain conditions.
CLIs: peer-link mac-address remain enable { unpaired-port | paired-port }
undo peer-link mac-address remain enable { unpaired-port | paired-port }

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that the M-LAG device does not trigger the peer M-LAG device to delete the corresponding MAC address on the peer-link interface when an M-LAG single-homing interface fails.
-

Indicates that the M-LAG device does not trigger the local M-LAG device to delete the corresponding MAC address on the peer-link interface when an M-LAG single-homing interface is changed to a dual-homing interface.
-

Examples: [*HUAWEI-dfs-group-1] undo peer-link mac-address remain enable unpaired-port
